result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense requests the Court set Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Court sets deadline of 1/12/2023 for filing of motions in limine, witness lists and jury instructions. Case adjourned to Br. 16. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 10:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-23-2022

Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and offer and requested more time; stop motion to be filed.  Motions to be filed by September 23, 2022.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-28-2022

Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in court, appear by video.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-2-2022

22RM022650  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/26/2022 sa

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karon Bozey-DeShay Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
